content:
• Wednesday, April 17, 2013
  • INVA

    Shares of Theravance (THRX) soar over 18% in the post-trading session after coming off an...

    Shares of Theravance (THRX) soar over 18% in the post-trading session after coming off an all-day trading halt while awaiting the FDA's decision on its COPD inhaler Breo Ellipta. The stock most recently traded at $33.25, after being halted earlier this morning at $28.01, as the FDA voted solidly in favor of approval.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:59 PM
  • AVL

    Avalon Rare Metals (NYSEMKT:AVL) says the results from feasibility studies for its Nechalacho...

    Avalon Rare Metals (NYSEMKT:AVL) says the results from feasibility studies for its Nechalacho rare earth elements project confirm that it's "technically feasible and economically robust." The company said total project construction capital costs are $1.575B, which is inclusive of a 13% contingency and $122M in sustaining capital. Operating costs will average $264.5M per year, while revenue sould average $645.8M per year. Shares +2% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:50 PM | 2 Comments
  • ALSN

    Allison Transmission (NYSE:ALSN) says funds associated with the Carlyle Group will not go...

    Allison Transmission (NYSE:ALSN) says funds associated with the Carlyle Group will not go through with a previously announced 22M share secondary offering "due to market conditions." Shares +8.74% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:58 PM
  • CONE

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: CONE +9%. SLCA +4%. MXIM +4%. LNC +4%. MHR +3%....

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: CONE +9%. SLCA +4%. MXIM +4%. LNC +4%. MHR +3%.
    After-hours top losers: SCSS -7%. CCK -4%. SNDK -3%. NAVB -3%. EBAY -2%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:45 PM
  • WDC

    SanDisk (SNDK) guides on its Q1 call (webcast) for Q2 revenue of $1.35B-$1.4B and 2013 revenue...

    SanDisk (SNDK) guides on its Q1 call (webcast) for Q2 revenue of $1.35B-$1.4B and 2013 revenue of $5.6B-$5.75B, largely above a consensus of $1.34B and $5.63B. Gross margin is expected to rise to 41%-43% in Q2, and 2013 gross margin guidance is now at 42%-44% (a 200 bps guidance hike). Q2 GM will benefit from higher prices and a weak yen, partly offset by lower royalties. SanDisk still forecasts 30%-40% NAND industry bit growth in 2013, and expects its own growth to be much lower, as it refrains from major capacity expansion. Shares now -0.6% AH. MU -0.4%. (previous)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:37 PM
  • CLB

    More on Core Labs' (NYSE:CLB) Q1 results: Issues Q2 EPS and revenue guidance above consensus;...

    More on Core Labs' (NYSE:CLB) Q1 results: Issues Q2 EPS and revenue guidance above consensus; raises FY 2013 guidance. Expects 2013 North American activity levels to stabilize at Q1 levels and international activity levels to rise ~7%, yielding a 5% worldwide activity increase. Shares +2.2% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:20 PM
  • CLB

    Core Laboratories (NYSE:CLB): Q1 EPS of $1.22 beats by $0.07. Revenue of $261M beats by $13.78M....

    Core Laboratories (NYSE:CLB): Q1 EPS of $1.22 beats by $0.07. Revenue of $261M beats by $13.78M. Shares +2.2% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:10 PM
  • CCK

    Crown Holdings (NYSE:CCK): Q1 EPS of $0.5 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $1.97B misses by $0.05B....

    Crown Holdings (NYSE:CCK): Q1 EPS of $0.5 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $1.97B misses by $0.05B. Shares -3.7% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:07 PM
  • SNBR

    Select Comfort (SCSS) slides 7.2% AH as the company's guidance disappoints. SCSS says it will...

    Select Comfort (SCSS) slides 7.2% AH as the company's guidance disappoints. SCSS says it will earn $1.30-1.45 per share in FY2013 versus previous guidance of $1.65-1.80. The Street meanwhile, was expecting $1.52. (See: SCSS misses)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:55 PM
  • WDC

    SanDisk (SNDK) now -5.8% AH and Micron (NASDAQ:MU) -1.5% following SanDisk's Q1 beat....

    SanDisk (SNDK) now -5.8% AH and Micron (NASDAQ:MU) -1.5% following SanDisk's Q1 beat. Expectations were high following SanDisk's 2013 run-up. Also, given strong NAND flash pricing, the Street may have been looking for a bigger gross margin improvement - GM rose 60 bps Q/Q and 460 bps Y/Y to 40.5%. SanDisk says SSD products accounted for 20% of sales. R&D spending rose 21% Y/Y, as the company ramps investments in proprietary SSD and embedded mobile offerings. CC at 5PM ET (webcast), guidance should be provided. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:46 PM | 1 Comment
  • IPI

    Intrepid Potash (NYSE:IPI) reports preliminary Q1 potash sales of 180K-190K tons, which it calls...

    Intrepid Potash (NYSE:IPI) reports preliminary Q1 potash sales of 180K-190K tons, which it calls "healthy" for the traditionally slower winter season, and notes solid production including steady improvement at its East facility. Expects full-year capex remains at $235M-$285M as progress on major progress tracks on schedule. Shares +2.8% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:32 PM
  • EBAY

    More on eBay: Q2 guidance is for revenue of $3.8B-$3.9B and EPS of $0.61-$0.63, below a...

    More on eBay: Q2 guidance is for revenue of $3.8B-$3.9B and EPS of $0.61-$0.63, below a consensus of $3.95B and $0.66. 2013 guidance unchanged (previous). Q1 PayPal revenue +18% Y/Y, payment volume +21% (both were +24% in Q4). PayPal active accounts +4% Q/Q and +16% Y/Y to 128M. Marketplaces revenue and GMV +13% (were +16% in Q4), driven by 16% U.S. GMV growth and 17% growth in fixed-price item GMV (68% of total). Marketplaces active users +3% Q/Q and +13% Y/Y to 116M. $476M in buybacks. Opex +9% Y/Y, less than rev. growth. 2.8M customers added via mobile. EBAY -2.5% AH. CC at 5PM ET (webcast). (PR) (slides)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:32 PM
  • SLM

    Sallie Mae (NYSE:SLM): Q1 EPS of $0.61 beats by $0.01. Shares +2.3% AH. (PR)

    Sallie Mae (NYSE:SLM): Q1 EPS of $0.61 beats by $0.01. Shares +2.3% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:30 PM
  • ATNY

    API Technologies (ATNY -5.1%) slides after saying it's completed its sale of Spectrum Sensors...

    API Technologies (ATNY -5.1%) slides after saying it's completed its sale of Spectrum Sensors and Controls, a designer and manufacturer of custom temperature probes, high reliability encoders and inertial sensors, to Measurement Specialties (MEAS -1.9%) for $51.4M.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:21 PM
  • EBAY

    eBay (NASDAQ:EBAY): Q1 EPS of $0.63 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $3.75B misses by $0.02B. Shares...

    eBay (NASDAQ:EBAY): Q1 EPS of $0.63 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $3.75B misses by $0.02B. Shares -2.4% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:16 PM
  • UNXL

    UniPixel (NASDAQ:UNXL) -1.8% AH after announcing a public stock offering of undisclosed size. In...

    UniPixel (NASDAQ:UNXL) -1.8% AH after announcing a public stock offering of undisclosed size. In the prospectus, UniPixel only says it will use the proceeds "for working capital and general corporate purposes" (such as UniBoss manufacturing efforts?)  Shares had jumped to new highs earlier today thanks to a bullish Williams Financial note. (PR) Update (5:58PM): Shares are now down 8.1% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:14 PM | 23 Comments
  • WDC

    SanDisk (SNDK): Q1 EPS of $0.84 beats by $0.05. Revenue of $1.34B beats by $0.04B. Shares -5.9%...

    SanDisk (SNDK): Q1 EPS of $0.84 beats by $0.05. Revenue of $1.34B beats by $0.04B. Shares -5.9% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:11 PM | 6 Comments
  • KMP

    Kinder Morgan Partners (NYSE:KMP): Q1 EPS of $0.97. Revenue of $2.66B beats by $0.2B. Shares...

    Kinder Morgan Partners (NYSE:KMP): Q1 EPS of $0.97. Revenue of $2.66B beats by $0.2B. Shares -1.4% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:10 PM
  • AXP

    American Express (NYSE:AXP): Q1 EPS of $1.15 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $7.9B misses by $0.15B....

    American Express (NYSE:AXP): Q1 EPS of $1.15 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $7.9B misses by $0.15B. Shares -1.1% AH. (PR)

  • CVA

    Covanta (NYSE:CVA): Q1 EPS of -$0.21 misses by $0.08. Revenue of $373M misses by $20.5M. Shares...

    Covanta (NYSE:CVA): Q1 EPS of -$0.21 misses by $0.08. Revenue of $373M misses by $20.5M. Shares -1.7% AH. (PR)

  • SNBR

    Select Comfort (SCSS): Q1 EPS of $0.41 misses by $0.02. Revenue of $258M (-2% Y/Y) misses by...

    Select Comfort (SCSS): Q1 EPS of $0.41 misses by $0.02. Revenue of $258M (-2% Y/Y) misses by $29.95M. Shares -14.5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:02 PM
  • RIG

    Carl Icahn issues a letter to Transocean (RIG -2.3%) shareholders urging them to vote for his...

    Carl Icahn issues a letter to Transocean (RIG -2.3%) shareholders urging them to vote for his proposal to increase the dividend to $4/share and to elect his three nominees for RIG's board of directors. RIG's own board nominees "have overseen the destruction of at least $11B of shareholder value," Icahn writes.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:59 PM | 2 Comments

  • Dollar strength against the "risk" currencies on these panicky sessions is often offset by...

    Dollar strength against the "risk" currencies on these panicky sessions is often offset by weakness vs. the yen, leading to little change in the dollar index. Not today - the greenback is surging against nearly every asset on the planet, leading the dollar bull ETF (UUP +1.1) to a relatively outsized gain. UDN -1.1%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:37 PM | 1 Comment
  • PRLB

    Shares of Proto Labs (PRLB -1%) are seeing some volatility late in the session in response to a...

    Shares of Proto Labs (PRLB -1%) are seeing some volatility late in the session in response to a negative article in SeekingAlpha this afternoon. The article  accuses the company of spinning the impact of 3D printing on its business in the hope that some of the hype will boost its stock, but the technology could actually destroy the company. The article also notes heavy insider selling, but it's worth noting that the author is also short the stock as well.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:35 PM | 1 Comment
  • EPD

    Enterprise Products Partners (EPD -0.4%) says it is considering options for its JV 210K bbl/day...

    Enterprise Products Partners (EPD -0.4%) says it is considering options for its JV 210K bbl/day Centennial refined products pipeline, such as a reversal or moving different products, because of low volumes shipped from the Gulf Coast to Illinois. The pipeline remains in service but it's not moving much now, EPD says without specifying volume levels. 50-50 partner MPC -2.6%.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:29 PM
  • HMY

    One of the stranger outcomes of gold's collapse is to make gold miners look more expensive,...

    One of the stranger outcomes of gold's collapse is to make gold miners look more expensive, which Nomura says means more downside for the miners. "Lower levels of investment demand have the equilibrium point for the gold price at still lower levels. [If so], the equities should still have further to retrace." It's another down day for South African miners: HMY -5.6%, GOLD -4.5%, AU -4%, GFI -1.2%. (also)

     
     
     
     
    | 3:15 PM | 6 Comments
  • POM

    Pepco Holdings (POM -1.3%) gets no love today from Credit Suisse, who cut the shares to...

    Pepco Holdings (POM -1.3%) gets no love today from Credit Suisse, who cut the shares to Underperform, but slightly raised it's price target from $20.50 to $21. The firm cites difficult-to-attain multiples due to a constrained ROE and rate concerns.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:11 PM
  • LUNMF

    Lundin Mining (OTCPK:LUNMF -10.4%) sinks after the Democratic Republic of Congo bans exports of...

    Lundin Mining (OTCPK:LUNMF -10.4%) sinks after the Democratic Republic of Congo bans exports of copper and cobalt concentrates in an attempt to force miners to add value to the commodities before shipping them outside the country. Lundin owns a 24% stake in the Tenke Fungurume mining project in Congo; Freeport McMoRan (FCX -5.5%) operates Tenke and owns 56%.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:42 PM | 1 Comment
  • MU

    Though Micron (MU -4.4%) and SanDisk (SNDK -4.2%) have joined a general rout in chip stocks and...

    Though Micron (MU -4.4%) and SanDisk (SNDK -4.2%) have joined a general rout in chip stocks and Apple suppliers, a report from Taiwan's Commercial Times indicates DRAM and NAND flash prices continue to trek higher (previous). Contract prices for mainstay 4GB DDR3 PC DRAM modules are said to have risen 8%-10% in early April, and contract prices for 32Gb (4GB) MLC NAND chips reportedly rose 5%-12%. Samsung (OTC:SSNLF) is another beneficiary of this trend. SanDisk reports after the close. (Samsung's purchases)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:23 PM | 1 Comment
  • MHRCQ

    Magnum Hunter (MHR -18.6%) is defended by SunTrust after the oil and gas explorer fired its...

    Magnum Hunter (MHR -18.6%) is defended by SunTrust after the oil and gas explorer fired its auditor, sending shares plunging, Analyst Neal Dingmann says a major writedown is unlikely, and he believes proven reserves, MHR's credit facility and sales in Eagle Ford will not be affected. SunTrust has a Buy rating on the stock with a $10 price target.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:13 PM | 7 Comments
  • BIOS

    BioScrip (BIOS -6.3%) slides today after announcing a $75M stock offering, while affiliates of...

    BioScrip (BIOS -6.3%) slides today after announcing a $75M stock offering, while affiliates of its largest shareholders offer an additional $25M. BIOS won't receive any proceeds from the shareholders' portion of the sale. Jefferies, Morgan Stanley and SunTrust Robinson Humphrey are acting as joint book-running managers. Additionally, the company says it intends to refinance its existing indebtedness with the proceeds of a new $325M senior secured credit facility, including a revolving credit facility and a term loan.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:12 PM

  • Another micro-cap ramping higher on the ricin scare is Soligenix (SNGX +13%), whose lead...

    Another micro-cap ramping higher on the ricin scare is Soligenix (SNGX +13%), whose lead biodefense products in development are a recombinant subunit vaccine called RiVax, which is designed to protect against the lethal effects of exposure to ricin, as well as VeloThrax, a vaccine against anthrax exposure.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:40 PM
  • DQ

    Daqo (DQ -4.3%) COO Qiangmin Zhou has left the company "for personal reasons." CEO Gongda Yaho...

    Daqo (DQ -4.3%) COO Qiangmin Zhou has left the company "for personal reasons." CEO Gongda Yaho will serve as acting COO for now. Daqo shares are lower, but so are those of many solar peers. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 1:27 PM
  • TDC

    Teradata (TDC -3.9%) is once more near its 52-week low after Off Wall Street Research reportedly...

    Teradata (TDC -3.9%) is once more near its 52-week low after Off Wall Street Research reportedly starts coverage with a Sell and $37.50 PT. The data warehousing/analytics solutions firm delivers its Q1 report on May 2. (Stifel) (Morgan Stanley)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:01 PM
  • IVR

    Often a spot to hide during big selloffs, mortgage REITs (MORT -2.3%) slide sharply as well,...

    Often a spot to hide during big selloffs, mortgage REITs (MORT -2.3%) slide sharply as well, particularly the hybrids (exposed to credit risk through non-agency MBS holdings). IVR -2.3%, TWO -3.3%, DX -2.5%. The sector giants: NLY -2.2%, AGNC -1.3%. One trader reminds mREITs are small caps and the Russell 2000 (IWM -2.2%) has been particularly hard hit of late. The 10-15% yields offer a nice palliative.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:01 PM | 2 Comments
  • ACUR

    Midday top 10 gainers: OTC:ACUR +53%. ECTY +16%. PCYG +16%. ALKS +15%. OCZ +15%. OGEN +14%. RECV...

    Midday top 10 gainers: OTC:ACUR +53%. ECTY +16%. PCYG +16%. ALKS +15%. OCZ +15%. OGEN +14%. RECV +12%. CASM +11%. OTC:ATLS +11%. CHLN +11%.
    Midday top 10 losers: EOPN -26%. CNIT-OLD -26%. INWK -25%. MHR -21%. CXW -18%. CRMB -16%. CRUS -16%. EPAX -14%. BMI -14%. EMXX -14%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:59 PM
  • VLO

    Energy stocks (XLE -2.8%) trade well below the broader market as crude oil futures plunge after...

    Energy stocks (XLE -2.8%) trade well below the broader market as crude oil futures plunge after a surprising drop in U.S. distillate supplies and a smaller drop in crude supplies than API data showed. With the U.S. dollar substantially higher, analyst Tariq Zahir sees crude continuing its downward trend. Refiners: VLO -3.9%, TSO -5.6%, PBF -6.3%, CVI -6.8%. Big losers: LPI -5.4%, HLX -5.9%, PDS -6.5%, PWE -5.8%, KOG -4.4%.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:57 PM
  • AAPL

    Apple (AAPL -5.8%) has hit levels last seen in Dec. '11 following Cirrus Logic's warning and a...

    Apple (AAPL -5.8%) has hit levels last seen in Dec. '11 following Cirrus Logic's warning and a Digitimes report about declining iPad Mini shipments. Cross Research calls Cirrus' warning "a reminder of weakening demand, and the challenges around product transitions" for Apple. Tero Kuittinen, noting sub-30M June quarter iPhone sales estimates and worries about the margin impact of emerging markets promotions, thinks "several nightmare scenarios have been priced in." "The naked fear of former Apple bulls is exactly what we need just before the earnings come out."

     
     
     
     
    | 12:55 PM | 55 Comments
  • AEZS

    AEterna Zentaris (AEZS -2%) says it's agreed to transfer rights and grant a manufacturing...

    AEterna Zentaris (AEZS -2%) says it's agreed to transfer rights and grant a manufacturing license for Cetrotide to a subsidiary of Merck KGaA. It will receive a one-time payment of about $3.2M for the transaction, as well as certain other payments to execute a 36-month transitional services agreement to provide various transition services to assist Merck KGaA in assuming responsibility for manufacturing.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:44 PM
  • EBS

    Shares of Emergent BioSolutions (EBS +1.2%) spike midday amid reports letters sent to...

    Shares of Emergent BioSolutions (EBS +1.2%) spike midday amid reports letters sent to congressmen and the President contained the poison ricin. EBS makes the anthrax vaccine BioThrax.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:40 PM
  • VALE

    Vale’s (VALE -3.6%) tax dispute with the government and the potential impact of...

    Vale’s (VALE -3.6%) tax dispute with the government and the potential impact of still-unspecified regulations might not be such a big problem, J. P. Morgan says. In the worst case, Vale would negotiate a settlement and agree and pay far less than the full $15.5B Brazil's government wants, and there's "a decent chance" it will pay nothing at all; the firm also sees momentum for a special participation tax slowing.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:36 PM
  • LLTC

    Chip stocks have a rough day (SOXX -2.8%) following Cirrus Logic's warning, light guidance from...

    Chip stocks have a rough day (SOXX -2.8%) following Cirrus Logic's warning, light guidance from Linear Technology (LLTC -4.6%) to go with a Q1 beat - Linear sees 1%-4% Q/Q revenue growth for calendar Q2, below a 4.7% consensus - and ho-hum Q1 results/Q2 guidance from Intel. Apple suppliers Broadcom (BRCM -4%), Avago (AVGO -5.5%), STMicroelectronics (STM -6.7%), NXP (NXPI -7%), RF Micro (RFMD -2.8%), and OmniVision (OVTI -3.3%) are among the casualties, but they're far from alone. ANAD -6.2%. STM -5.7%. FSL -5%. ADI -4.5%. TXN -4.4%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:26 PM
  • LAYN

    Shares of Layne Christensen (LAYN -0.9%) hit a new year low this morning as the stock continues...

    Shares of Layne Christensen (LAYN -0.9%) hit a new year low this morning as the stock continues to slide after the company reported a Q4 earnings miss late Tuesday. DA Davidson notes that operating results should improve in the current quarter due to normal seasonal factors, however the continued sharp falloff in mine-development investment and further declines in commodity prices suggest the segment will likely to remain under pressure for the next year. It shaves it's price target to $20 from $21.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:14 PM
  • HK

    Newly-acquired Eagle Ford assets are a "huge opportunity" for Halcon Resources (HK -4.1%),...

    Newly-acquired Eagle Ford assets are a "huge opportunity" for Halcon Resources (HK -4.1%), CEO Floyd Wilson tells Jim Cramer in making the investment case for his company. Wilson says HK's Utica assets are delivering more oil than gas at this point, something he was hoping would happen.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:13 PM | 4 Comments
  • HPQ

    H-P (HPQ -2.1%), Seagate (STX -2.6%), and Western Digital (WDC -2.8%) underperform after UBS'...

    H-P (HPQ -2.1%), Seagate (STX -2.6%), and Western Digital (WDC -2.8%) underperform after UBS' Maynard Um argues Intel's (INTC -1.3%) Q1 report backs up his thesis that "PC pricing needs to come down ... to entice upgrades." Um thinks this will lead to margin pressure for OEMs, and an unfavorable mix shift for hard drive vendors. He also notes H-P/Dell might not benefit from Intel's server CPU strength, since it's fueled by cloud buyers who often rely on white-label gear. Also: Paul Otellini stated on Intel's Q1 call he expects Window 8 (NASDAQ:MSFT) touch devices (7" tablets?) using Intel's upcoming Bay Trail Atom CPU to eventually sport ~$200 price points.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:54 AM | 3 Comments
  • HES

    Hess (HES -3.4%) will sell one of its only two Algerian oil stakes to Spain's Cepsa due to poor...

    Hess (HES -3.4%) will sell one of its only two Algerian oil stakes to Spain's Cepsa due to poor return potential, Reuters reports, as it will seek better terms for its $1B-plus investment in the remaining block. Hess reportedly will focus on its production at the Gassi El Agreb complex, which it shares with Algeria's state oil company Sonatrach.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:38 AM
  • QIHU

    Qihoo (QIHU +3.2%) rallies after Barclays' Alicia Yap starts coverage with an Overweight and $38...

    Qihoo (QIHU +3.2%) rallies after Barclays' Alicia Yap starts coverage with an Overweight and $38 PT. Yap is optimistic about improving search ad revenue as Qihoo ramps its salesforce, mobile opportunities fueled by Qihoo's popular security software and app store, and margin expansion (eventually reaching 40%). Thus far, Qihoo shares have spent 2013 digesting their big 2H12 gains.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:30 AM
  • GALT

    Galectin Therapeutics (GALT +7.6%) gains after announcing it will present evidence gathered...

    Galectin Therapeutics (GALT +7.6%) gains after announcing it will present evidence gathered during pre-clinicals that its drugs can reverse liver fibrosis and cirrhosis at the International Liver Congress on April 27. The company says positive data is "accumulating" that its galactic inhibitor drugs are effective.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:14 AM
  • FWM

    Fairway Market (NASDAQ:FWM) soars 28% on its first day of trading after setting its IPO price at...

    Fairway Market (NASDAQ:FWM) soars 28% on its first day of trading after setting its IPO price at $13. The grocery store chain is seeing a round of unexpected buying after its SEC filing revealed it posted a $56M loss over its reporting period. (S-1)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:02 AM
  • VECO

    Veeco (VECO -7.7%) and Aixtron (AIXG -5.6%) get hammered after Digitimes reports the companies...

    Veeco (VECO -7.7%) and Aixtron (AIXG -5.6%) get hammered after Digitimes reports the companies slashed prices for single-wafer MOCVD LED manufacturing systems to ~$1.4M from ~$2M, and 30%-40% for multi-wafer systems, due to Chinese competition. The companies have already been struggling with weak equipment demand on account of overcapacity: Digitimes Research estimates MOCVD shipments will fall 46% this year to 148; Veeco is seen shipping 89 of them, and Aixtron 53. Cree (CREE -3.7%) and GT Advanced (GTAT -4.2%) are also selling off.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:01 AM | 1 Comment
  • PTIE

    Shares of Pain Therapeutics (PTIE +1.4%) benefit from the FDA's "public health priority" call on...

    Shares of Pain Therapeutics (PTIE +1.4%) benefit from the FDA's "public health priority" call on abuse-deterrent opioid analgesics. PTIE is developing Remoxy, an abuse-resistant form of oxycodone in conjunction with Pfizer (NYSE:PFE). Other names moving on the news: ACUR +70% and ENDP +3.2%.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:56 AM
  • GT

    Rubber-related stocks are having a tough day with Goodyear Tire & Rubber (GT -3.4%), Cooper...

    Rubber-related stocks are having a tough day with Goodyear Tire & Rubber (GT -3.4%), Cooper Tire & Rubber (CTB -2.6%), Berry Plastics Group (BERY -4.4%) and Titan International (TWI -3.6%) all dipping lower. Macroeconomic concerns and news on higher rubber duties could be swaying sentiment.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:50 AM
  • LNG

    Cheniere Energy (LNG -1.5%) is initiated by BB&T with a Buy rating, believing the current...

    Cheniere Energy (LNG -1.5%) is initiated by BB&T with a Buy rating, believing the current valuation does not fully capture projected out year cash flow growth from Sabine Pass and Corpus Christi investments. Future developments regrading liquefaction and pipeline buildout, additional DOE approval, and further off-take agreements could result in meaningful upside to shares.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:49 AM | 3 Comments
  • OCZ

    OCZ (OCZ +23.6%) rips higher after preannouncing revenue of $65M-$75M and a positive gross...

    OCZ (OCZ +23.6%) rips higher after preannouncing revenue of $65M-$75M and a positive gross margin for the Feb. quarter (FQ4). Though the revenue range isn't great, the Street seems more interested OCZ is actually reporting something for the quarter, after repeatedly delaying the filing of its Aug. and Nov. '12 quarter 10-Qs. Some other details: OCZ had an FQ4 unshipped backlog of $18M due to NAND flash constraints; it has paid off its Wells Fargo credit facility, and taken out a loan from Hercules Growth Capital; and it has requested a hearing regarding its NASDAQ delisting notice.

    Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL) -1.2% after Cirrus Logic (NASDAQ:CRUS), which gets over half of its revenue from the company, issues a revenue warning for the March and June quarters (FQ4 and FQ1). Though Cirrus' FQ4 revenue forecast of $206.9M is only a little below a $210.2M consensus, its FQ1 forecast of $150M-$170M is well below a $195.2M consensus. The audio codec chipmaker also says it will take a $23.3M write-down, $20.7M of which is due to "a decreased forecast for a high volume product" as a customer (quite possibly Apple) migrates to a new component (could be a sign of a new iPhone). SWKS -2.2%. QCOM -0.9%.
